awd_titl_txt: Digital Signal Processing to Compensate for Sensorineural   Hearing Impairments
awd_abstract_narration: This is a proposal to lay the                                                   technological foundation for the                                                development of a state-of-the-art                                               digital hearing aid for individuals                                             with sensorineural hearing                                                      impairments, especially those                                                   accompanied by "recruitment of                                                  loudness".  The research is to                                                  develop a digital signal processing                                             system to compress speech in order                                              to compensate for the problem.  The                                             scheme, based on a model that                                                   breaks speech into sinusoidal                                                   components, uses an adaptive                                                    algorithm with frequency dependent                                              gains and thresholds for the                                                    compensation.  If successful, the                                               research will have a significant                                                impact on the design of hearing                                                 aids.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
